title: Provides additional fines and penalties for the unauthorized use of a driver's license or non-driver identification card
summary: Provides additional fines and penalties for the unauthorized use of a driver's license or non-driver identification card.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1555

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. ORTIZ -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in  relation  to  penalties
         for the unauthorized use of a driver's license or non-driver identifi-
         cation card

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The vehicle and traffic law is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 1804 to read as follows:
    3    S 1804. DRIVER'S LICENSE AND NON-DRIVER IDENTIFICATION CARD; UNAUTHOR-
    4  IZED  USE.  1. IN ADDITION TO ANY OTHER FINES AND PENALTIES SET FORTH IN
    5  THE PENAL LAW OR ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, ANY PERSON WHO KNOWINGLY:
    6    (A) OFFERS AS HIS OR HER OWN, A DRIVER'S LICENSE OR  NON-DRIVER  IDEN-
    7  TIFICATION CARD TO ANY PERSON AS PROOF OF AGE WHEN SUCH DRIVER'S LICENSE
    8  OR NON-DRIVER IDENTIFICATION CARD IS NOT HIS OR HER OWN; OR
    9    (B)  FALSELY  MAKES OR FALSELY ALTERS A DRIVER'S LICENSE OR NON-DRIVER
   10  IDENTIFICATION CARD, SHALL BE SUBJECT TO THE  FINES  AND  PENALTIES  SET
   11  FORTH  IN SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION,
   12  THE TERMS "FALSELY MAKES" AND "FALSELY ALTERS" SHALL HAVE THE SAME MEAN-
   13  INGS AS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISIONS FOUR AND SIX, RESPECTIVELY, OF SECTION
   14  170.00 OF THE PENAL LAW.
   15    2. ANY PERSON WHO OFFERS, FALSELY MAKES OR FALSELY ALTERS  A  DRIVER'S
   16  LICENSE OR NON-DRIVER IDENTIFICATION CARD PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION ONE OF
   17  THIS SECTION, SHALL:
   18    (A)  FOR A FIRST OFFENSE, BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS
   19  AND SUSPENSION OF HIS OR HER DRIVER'S LICENSE OR NON-DRIVER  IDENTIFICA-
   20  TION CARD FOR SIX MONTHS;
   21    (B) FOR A SECOND OFFENSE, BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS
   22  AND  SUSPENSION OF HIS OR HER DRIVER'S LICENSE OR NON-DRIVER IDENTIFICA-
   23  TION CARD FOR ONE YEAR; AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03924-01-1

       A. 1555                             2

    1    (C) FOR A THIRD OFFENSE, BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS
    2  AND SUSPENSION OF HIS OR HER DRIVER'S LICENSE OR NON-DRIVER  IDENTIFICA-
    3  TION  CARD  FOR  THREE YEARS OR UNTIL SUCH PERSON IS TWENTY-ONE YEARS OF
    4  AGE, WHICHEVER IS GREATER.
    5    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
    6  have become a law.
